November 5, 1909                        Sanitarium, California B.-140-                                       November 5, 1909 

Elder J. A. Burden Loma Linda, California 

Dear Brother Burden: 


     Some questions have been asked me regarding our relation to the laws governing medical practitioners. We need to move understandingly, for the enemy would be pleased to hedge up our work so that our physicians would have only a limited influence. Some men do not act in the fear of God, and they may seek to bring us into trouble by placing on our necks yokes that we could not consent to bear. We cannot submit to regulations if the sacrifice of principle is involved; for 
                                                                           301
this would imperil the soul's salvation.
